dt: {bc}causing feelings of worry, concern, or anxiety

dt.t: The next phase in which I had a part was even more {wi}disturbing{/wi}, and infinitely more painful.

utxt.t: … the texture of ordinary life and talk has taken on a {wi}disturbingly{/wi} ambiguous quality …

shortdef: causing feelings of worry, concern, or anxiety

dt: {bc}to alter the position or arrangement of

dt.t: the items on her desk had been {wi}disturbed{/wi}

dt: {bc}to upset the natural and especially the ecological balance or relations of

dt.t: trying not to {wi}disturb{/wi} the sleeping dogs
sorry to {wi}disturb{/wi} you at such a late hour

pt: {sc}discompose{/sc} {sc}disquiet{/sc} {sc}disturb{/sc} {sc}perturb{/sc} {sc}agitate{/sc} {sc}upset{/sc} {sc}fluster{/sc} mean to destroy capacity for collected thought or decisive action. {sc}discompose{/sc} implies some degree of loss of self-control or self-confidence especially through emotional stress.

pt.t: {it}discomposed{/it} by the loss of his beloved wife

pt: {sc}disquiet{/sc} suggests loss of sense of security or peace of mind.
{sc}disturb{/sc} implies interference with one's mental processes caused by worry, perplexity, or interruption.
{sc}perturb{/sc} implies deep disturbance of mind and emotions.
{sc}agitate{/sc} suggests obvious external signs of nervous or emotional excitement.

pt.t: in his {it}agitated{/it} state we could see he was unable to work

pt: {sc}upset{/sc} implies the disturbance of normal or habitual functioning by disappointment, distress, or grief.

pt.t: the family's constant bickering {it}upsets{/it} the youngest child
his declaration of love completely {it}flustered{/it} her

et: Middle English {it}disturben, destourben{/it}, from Anglo-French & Latin; Anglo-French {it}destorber{/it}, from Latin {it}disturbare{/it}, from {it}dis-{/it} + {it}turbare{/it} to throw into disorder, from {it}turba{/it} disorder {ma}{mat|turbid|}{/ma}
shortdef: to alter the position or arrangement of
to upset the natural and especially the ecological balance or relations of
